AD_TransitionsToSecondPhase.synopsis: During combat, the orthon escalates to phase two (intensifying his attacks and changing up his tactics). This is prompted by:- killing a certain number of minions- lowering his HP a certain amount- surviving for a certain number of combat rounds
AD_TransitionsToSecondPhase.how_to_trigger: Engage in combat with the Orthon. Survive X number of rounds/kill X number of merregons/lower the Orthon's HP by X

AD_DisplacerGrowl.synopsis: The Displacer beast growls at the player if the player gets too close to it while it is in its idle behaviour if the Orthon is not hostile to the player.

AD_KilledEnemy.synopsis: The Orthon's shouts upon killing a (non-summon) enemy. Taunting and belittling his opponents, claiming they pose no challenge.
AD_KilledEnemy.how_to_trigger: Let the Orthon kill an enemy who's not a summon.

AD.synopsis: The Orthon mumble-sings to himself while idle in his lair in the Shar Temple. Occasionally he interrupts the lyrics with frustrated outbursts.This occurs after the ambush scene, where we learn that the song is his contract, and will remain stuck in his head until he fulfills the terms.
AD.how_to_trigger: Navigate to the Orthon's Lair and resolve SHA_Orthon_TrespassLair peacefully. The Orthon's AD should begin as he starts his post-ambush behaviours.

AD_AmbushStartsAtUpperFloor.synopsis: Orhton's ambush starts because players were found at the upper floor of the Orthon's lair.
AD_AmbushStartsAtUpperFloor.how_to_trigger: goto -653; 4; -781Move towards -661; 4; -762 and start the encounter.

individual_metadata.synopsis: This occurs if the player has successfully convinced the orthon to let them stay in his lair. They did so by telling him they'd search the temple for a way of freeing him from his contract.If the player resolves the Last Justiciar contract, they can inform Yurgir. If they killed the justiciar, Raphael will appear and negotiate with Yurgir. If the player spared the justiciar, they can confront and fight Yurgir.
individual_metadata.how_to_trigger: Speak to the orthon after convincing him to let you stay.

AD_FormLines.synopsis: Orthon tells the merregons to get close to him during combat.

TrespassLair.synopsis: Dialogue with the Orthon, where he tells you it was ordered by Raphael to kill Ketheric's Dark Justiciars. The dialogue ends in combat, unless you succeed some very hard persuasions.Orthon is huge, forboding and loves a good fight. He speaks in a low rumble and is TERRIFYING.
TrespassLair.how_to_trigger: Walk to Orthon's gory throne at-646; -6; -754

AD_MineClusterAbility.synopsis: Spoken as the orthon throws timed explosives at the player during combat.
AD_MineClusterAbility.how_to_trigger: Start combat against him and wait till he casts Projectile_MineCluster_Orthon.

PAD_VictimsDisplay.synopsis: In Shar temple, there is a number of mutilated corpses - justiciars killed by Orthon. But he not only killed them, but he also created various installments of them, put them on spikes, hang them, etc

AD_VictimStand.synopsis: Narrator AD that pops up when clicking on Orthons's victims on display in Shar temple. They are pretty different so text needs to be universally fitting.

AD_BetrayedByDisplacer.synopsis: Orthon and Displacer fight between each other.
AD_BetrayedByDisplacer.how_to_trigger: Once the ambush has been peacefully resolved, interact with the meat at -646; -5; -722 and discover that it has been poisoned. Then speak with the displacer using Speak with Animals and convince it to fight with you. Once she agrees attack the Orthon and make it so it joins you in combat.

AD_MonitorLeaves.synopsis: Raphael leaves while at the Orthon, in case he is attacked.
AD_MonitorLeaves.how_to_trigger: 1. Complete the Orthon's contract2. Attack Raphael

AD_TransitionsToSecondPhase_0.speaker: Yurgir
AD_TransitionsToSecondPhase_0.text: Bravo - that almost stung. Perhaps I'll make a merregon of you, once you're dead.
AD_TransitionsToSecondPhase_0.context: NodeContext: Pronuncation: mer-eh-gone. Taunting, during combat. The player has injured the Orthon, who responds by changing up his tactics after this utterance.

AD_TransitionsToSecondPhase_1.speaker: Yurgir
AD_TransitionsToSecondPhase_1.text: Had your fill of my merregons yet? I'm right here, if you dare.
AD_TransitionsToSecondPhase_1.context: InternalNodeContext: Triggers during combat after multiple merregon opponents are killedNodeContext: Pronuncation: mer-eh-gone. Taunting, during combat. The player has killed several of his merregon followers.

AD_TransitionsToSecondPhase_2.speaker: Yurgir
AD_TransitionsToSecondPhase_2.text: Fight's gotten stale, little rabbit. Stop embarrassing yourself - let me end this.
AD_TransitionsToSecondPhase_2.context: NodeContext: Taunting. Wants to bring the fight to a swift resolution.

AD_DisplacerGrowl_0.speaker: Displacer Beast
AD_DisplacerGrowl_0.context: InternalNodeContext: SFX only. Displacer growl.NodeContext: SFX only. Displacer growl.

AD_KilledEnemy_0.speaker: Yurgir
AD_KilledEnemy_0.text: Another kill for me - aren't you embarrassed?!
AD_KilledEnemy_0.context: NodeContext: Battle taunt  on killing an opponent - 'that the best you have?'

AD_KilledEnemy_1.speaker: Yurgir
AD_KilledEnemy_1.text: Where's the challenge? Should I blindfold myself? Use one arm?
AD_KilledEnemy_1.context: NodeContext: Battle taunt  on killing an opponent - 'that the best you have?'

AD_KilledEnemy_2.speaker: Yurgir
AD_KilledEnemy_2.context: NodeContext: Battle taunt  on killing an opponent - 'that the best you have?'. Lemure = lay-mee-OR, a debased form of lower devil

AD_KilledEnemy_3.speaker: Yurgir
AD_KilledEnemy_3.text: Pathetic. If you can't fight with style, at least die with style.
AD_KilledEnemy_3.context: NodeContext: Battle taunt  on killing an opponent - 'that the best you have?'

AD_0.speaker: Yurgir
AD_0.text: Silence all prayers; smother each rite... blasted song!
AD_0.context: NodeContext: Singing to himself, with an exasperated outburst at the end

AD_1.speaker: Yurgir
AD_1.text: Wander Shar's halls; hungry to slay...
AD_1.context: NodeContext: Singing to himself, trailing off with an exasperated groan at the end.

AD_2.speaker: Yurgir
AD_2.text: Spill all the blood sworn to the night.

AD_3.speaker: Yurgir
AD_3.text: Even a chorus of screams can't drown out the song.
AD_3.context: NodeContext: Frustrated at the song stuck in his head.

AD_AmbushStartsAtUpperFloor_0.speaker: Yurgir
AD_AmbushStartsAtUpperFloor_0.text: Think you can get the drop on me? Wrong. Merregons - rip out their lungs!
AD_AmbushStartsAtUpperFloor_0.context: NodeContext: Mer-eh-gone. Angry/hostile (player sneaked up on him)

7.speaker: Yurgir
7.text: The song remains. Seems you haven't dealt with this imaginary Justiciar of yours.

73.speaker: Karlach
73.text: Holy shit. An orthon. Powerful devils - I wouldn't get on their bad side without a good reason.

38.speaker: Yurgir
38.text: You - tiefling. You've got the stench of the Hells about you - the stench of home. And a whiff of the surface besides.

119.speaker: Yurgir
119.text: A servant of Zariel, if I'm not mistaken. I'd know the reek of her infernal machinery anywhere.

103.speaker: Karlach
103.text: What do you know of infernal machinery?
103.context: NodeContext: To the orthon. Adversarial, but she's hoping he knows something useful.

8.speaker: Yurgir
8.text: Only what I can smell. And whatever engine burns within you is grinding to an inevitable explosion. Burning and fear - you reek with it.

76.speaker: Yurgir
76.text: You've got the stench of the Hells about you - the stench of home. And a whiff of the surface besides.

54.speaker: Yurgir
54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Palm of one hand raised in a 'hold on' gesture. Head cocked, listening.InternalNodeContext: This greeting if the Last Justiciar contract has been completed by the playerNodeContext: Glimmer of hope. Hushing the player, listening intently.

69.speaker: Yurgir
69.text: ...It's gone. The song is gone! The contract is completed!
69.context: NodeContext: Elated roar. Realising he's free.

15.speaker: Narrator
15.text: *You feel a telltale ache coming from the wound in your hand. Pain will soon grip you - for what you have done.*
15.context: CinematicNodeContext: SH concerned expression, anticipating wound flare-up post scene. CFR river stas

42.speaker: Player
42.text: It seems you're free to go.

5.speaker: Raphael
5.text: I think 'free' might be rather overstating matters, Yurgir. Devil's in the details, you see, and the details are in the fine print.
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael magically appears. The orthon snarls and aims his bow at the cambion

124.speaker: Raphael
124.text: You were to fulfil the deal. Nowhere does it stipulate you could subcontract the last kill to the first adventurers' party that came trotting along.

108.speaker: Raphael
108.text: In short: you're in breach of contract, my friend. Oh dear.

1.speaker: Yurgir
1.text: Back to the Hells with what we agreed! I have you now, Raphael. Pay the debt, and I will make this quick.

27.speaker: Raphael
27.text: Consider your position. You are about to forfeit what reputation you have left. No contracts. No fame. No power. You'll be a streak of excrement even lemures will slither away from.

17.speaker: Raphael
17.text: Unless, of course, you consider instead my infinite mercy. A new contract. A chance to balance the books. Not to mention a welcome change of scenery.

106.speaker: Yurgir
106.text: ...Bastard. Fine. On one condition - no more songs.
106.context: CinematicNodeContext: Long, hateful scowl from the Orthon, before he finally relents, lowers his crossbow and answers.

60.speaker: Raphael
60.text: What's a contract without whimsy, I say, but fine: no more songs. Now off to the House of Hope for cocktails and canapés - and a brand new signature on a brand new deal.

99.speaker: Raphael
99.text: But first, it would be only befitting if you reward your subcontractor. The greater reward for the greater hunter.

85.speaker: Yurgir
85.text: Anything I leave behind is yours. Pick over it however you like.
85.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to playerNodeContext: Dismissive

61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael, the Orthon, and all his remaining retinue (displacer and merregons) poof away.

53.speaker: Yurgir
53.text: Now leave me. I must prepare for my return to Hell - triumphant.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: You're lucky I came along to help. Now you owe me.

129.speaker: Yurgir
129.text: Owe you? Every breath you take from this moment on is my reward to you. Few walk away from me intact.

9.speaker: Raphael
9.text: Few may walk away from you intact, Yurgir, but none walk away from me in violation of their deal.
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael magically appears. The orthon snarls and aims his bow at the cambion

78.speaker: Raphael
78.text: Devil's in the details, you see, and the details are in the fine print.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: There was one last Justiciar - dead now. Raphael helped him hide from you.

102.speaker: Yurgir
102.text: That conniving sack of worms. I should've known. I've should've ripped his tongue out before he even spoke of this contract.

75.speaker: Raphael
75.text: Here I am, Yurgir, tongue and all, precisely on time for a lesson in semantics.
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raphael magically appears. The orthon snarls and aims his bow at the cambion

33.speaker: Yurgir
33.text: Those who live to speak my name call me Yurgir.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: Song? Contract? What are you talking about?

100.speaker: Yurgir
100.text: I was bid by Raphael to slay every Justiciar I found in this place. The contract was a song, one stuck in my head until I finished the deed. I had to hum that blasted tune for years.

18.speaker: Yurgir
18.text: But now the song has stopped - the contract is fulfilled. I suppose you showing up at the same time is no coincidence...

68.speaker: Yurgir
68.text: You're supposed to be searching these ruins, little rabbit. Given up already?

87.speaker: Astarion
87.text: Can we please kill it this time?

111.speaker: Astarion
111.text: This is what Raphael wants us to kill? Well, if that's what it takes to figure out what these damn scars mean...
111.context: NodeContext: Not looking forward to this fight - you're up against a big boi

114.speaker: Karlach
114.text: Holy shit. An orthon. Powerful devils - I wouldn't get on their bad side without a good reason.

82.speaker: Yurgir
82.text: You - tiefling. You've got the stench of the Hells about you - the stench of home. And a whiff of the surface besides.

31.speaker: Yurgir
31.text: You've got the stench of the Hells about you - the stench of home. And a whiff of the surface besides.

97.speaker: Yurgir
97.text: A servant of Zariel, if I'm not mistaken. I'd know the reek of her infernal machinery anywhere.

115.speaker: Karlach
115.text: What do you know of infernal machinery?
115.context: NodeContext: To the orthon. Adversarial, but she's hoping he knows something useful.

118.speaker: Yurgir
118.text: Only what I can smell. And whatever engine burns within you is grinding to an inevitable explosion. Burning and fear - you reek with it.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: An orthon. Fancy seeing one of you so far from the Hells.

79.speaker: Yurgir
79.text: Thought I smelled the stench of Avernus.

121.speaker: Yurgir
121.text: Yes - I'd recognise it anywhere. Zariel. The oily reek of her infernal machinery.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: What do you know of infernal machinery?

86.speaker: Yurgir
86.text: Only what I can smell. And whatever engine burns within you is grinding to an inevitable explosion. Burning and fear - it's all over you.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: I'm done with Zariel. Dealt with enough devils to last a lifetime.

56.speaker: Yurgir
56.text: And a short one it will be, by the smell of that engine. What will it be - hours? Days? Finish your search before we both run out of time.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: I'm not here to talk about Zariel.

49.speaker: Yurgir
49.text: No. You're here to solve my problem. I suggest you prove yourself useful.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: I am a Dark Justiciar now. That makes you my enemy.

58.speaker: Yurgir
58.text: You what? No new darkcloaks have been sworn in for years here - not since I arrived.

55.speaker: Yurgir
55.text: So you're telling me you completed the rites? Congratulations, little rabbit. I suppose I'd better kill you now.
55.context: NodeContext: Utters a chuckle before speaking with vicious amusement - player has signed their death warrant in his eyes.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: I found one last Justiciar, hiding in plain sight. He's in a chamber right below you.

109.speaker: Yurgir
109.text: Don't insult me - I'd know if there was a Justiciar down there.

40.speaker: Yurgir
40.text: But go on - spill some blood, prove me wrong. If there truly is a Justiciar, the song will end and you will be vindicated.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: I found your quarry. But I will not harm him - nor will you.

16.speaker: Yurgir
16.text: What...? You think you can flaunt my prize - my freedom - under my nose, then deny it?
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Angry snarl, crossbow raisedNodeContext: Slow realisation of what the player is telling him, before flying into a fury.

95.speaker: Yurgir
95.text: I will take care of him. After I've shown you your own heart.
95.context: CinematicNodeContext: Angry snarl, crossbow raisedInternalNodeContext: Combat after this node.NodeContext: Vicious.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: Those potions you use on the displacer - where might I get some of those?
45.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if the player already asked about the displacer being charmed, but hadn't asked to try the potions for themselves.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: Have you noticed anything strange about the rats around here?

89.speaker: Yurgir
89.text: The rats? Why would I pay attention to some puny vermin?

26.speaker: Yurgir
26.text: You'd better start taking this hunt more seriously, or you'll wish you were a bloody rat!

127.speaker: Player
127.text: Not at all. I think I'll make short work of this - show you how it's done.
127.context: InternalNodeContext: Local flag unsets when the player acknowledges the Orthon's query in N200

105.speaker: Yurgir
105.text: Remember you said that, when you fail. You won't smile so easily when I peel the face off your skull.
105.context: NodeContext: Vicious. Chaffing at the player's bravado.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Just getting my bearings. This place is confounding.
32.context: InternalNodeContext: Local flag unsets when the player acknowledges the Orthon's query in N200

35.speaker: Yurgir
35.text: Give it a decade, or ten - then you'll know it like the back of your hand.

93.speaker: Yurgir
93.text: Though in truth, you won't have that long. Not even close.
93.context: NodeContext: Wicked, predatory. Anticipating the player's failure.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Any suggestions on where to look?
20.context: InternalNodeContext: Local flag unsets when the player acknowledges the Orthon's query in N200

98.speaker: Yurgir
98.text: Suggestions? So much for your superior hunting skills.
98.context: NodeContext: Mocking incredulity at the player asking for tips.

88.speaker: Yurgir
88.text: I suggest you think twice before pestering me, or our truce may end prematurely.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: I met a necromancer, Balthazar, elsewhere in the temple. Perhaps he's the one you need to kill.
104.context: InternalNodeContext: Alt question for cases where SHA_Orthon_Event_OrthonQuestionsSearch has already been set before the topic of Balthazar is raised

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Hardly - I already found a necromancer, Balthazar, elsewhere in the temple. Perhaps he's the one you need to kill.

51.speaker: Yurgir
51.text: I caught the scent of that bloated carcass already - he's no more alive than the Dark Justiciars down here.

70.speaker: Yurgir
70.text: He is not the answer. He is not my prey.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: An impressive companion, your displacer. But a handful, I'd imagine.

14.speaker: Yurgir
14.text: You'd imagine wrong. Nessa is as loyal as can be.

67.speaker: Yurgir
67.text: Do not provoke her. I am her master - all others are a potential meal.

71.speaker: Yurgir
71.text: Now answer my question - are you still searching this place, or have you failed already?

11.speaker: Player
11.text: I know what you're feeding that displacer charm potions. Curious way of ensuring the beast's loyalty.

126.speaker: Yurgir
126.text: Curious? No - effective. A hunter needs to ensure his tools are dependable.

50.speaker: Yurgir
50.text: Ensuring Nessa's loyalty is as important as having sharpened blades and an oiled crossbow.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Clever. I'd like to try that for myself.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: So you charm the displacer yourself?

63.speaker: Yurgir
63.text: What's the point in having lackeys if I've to do everything myself? The quartermaster makes sure the displacer's meals are properly seasoned.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Just admiring your enterprise. I'd like to try it out for myself.

65.speaker: Yurgir
65.text: See my quartermaster. It may have some spare potions to sell you - let you experiment for yourself.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: It's wrong - even a beast like that shouldn't be treated in such a way.

29.speaker: Yurgir
29.text: Treated like what? Pampered? Fed? Given a master to adore?

116.speaker: Yurgir
116.text: Spare me your bleeding heart. Unless you'd like me to pluck it out and show it to you.

113.speaker: Yurgir
113.text: For a moment, I thought you were going to challenge me. Wise, that you didn't.

91.speaker: Yurgir
91.text: I still hear the song, which means you've achieved nothing. Keep looking, or I'll decorate every corner of this place with pieces of you.

110.speaker: Yurgir
110.text: Away now. There is nothing more for you here, unless you're offering yourself as hunting practice.

112.speaker: Yurgir
112.text: You're wasting time, little rabbit. Hoping I'll show mercy instead?

AD_FormLines_0.speaker: Yurgir
AD_FormLines_0.text: Form up ranks! Don't let anything get past you!
AD_FormLines_0.context: NodeContext: During combat. Bellowing orders to his merregon soldiers to change formation

TrespassLair_121.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player enters a gore-soaked alcove and approaches the displacer.There's various severed heads on display - people and monsters. A pile of eviscerated corpses forms a throne-chaise.
There's suddenly a loud click from above (implied to be the orthon racking/loading its crossbow). The player looks up.
The orthon looms on a gallery/crumpling floor overlooking the alcove. It aims a crossbow at the player. Flanking it are several merregons.

TrespassLair_202.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_202.text: But you're too fresh for this place, aren't you? You've got the stench of the Hells about you - the stench of home. And a whiff of the surface besides.

TrespassLair_67.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_67.text: A servant of Zariel, if I'm not mistaken. I'd know the stench of her infernal machinery anywhere.

TrespassLair_161.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_161.text: You trying to burrow back home, little rabbit?

TrespassLair_143.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_143.text: What do you know about infernal machinery?

TrespassLair_3.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_3.text: Only what I can smell. And whatever engine burns within you is grinding to an inevitable explosion. Burning and fear - you reek with it.

TrespassLair_169.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_169.text: I don't serve Zariel. And I'm going up - not down.

TrespassLair_188.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_188.text: Something tells me you aren't going anywhere at all. You must know it too, reeking of fear as you do.

TrespassLair_216.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_216.text: I'm never going back to Avernus. But I'd be happy to send you there.

TrespassLair_31.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_31.text: Such high confidence for someone who reeks so distinctively of fear.

TrespassLair_160.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_160.text: But you're too fresh for this place, aren't you? There's a whiff of the surface to you...
TrespassLair_160.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Orthon sniffs the air before delivering line.InternalNodeContext: Tagged subnodes for:
- REALLY_UNDERDARK
- UNDERDARK/Not REALLY_UNDERDARK (ie disguised)
- UntaggedNodeContext: Sniffs the air just before speaking, as if detecting something,

TrespassLair_173.speaker: Karlach
TrespassLair_173.text: Holy shit. An orthon. Powerful devils - I wouldn't get on their bad side without a good reason.

TrespassLair_257.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_257.text: You - tiefling. You've got the stench of the Hells about you - the stench of home. And a whiff of the surface besides.

TrespassLair_197.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_197.text: You've got the stench of the Hells about you - the stench of home. And a whiff of the surface besides.

TrespassLair_211.speaker: Karlach
TrespassLair_211.text: What do you know of infernal machinery?
TrespassLair_211.context: NodeContext: To the orthon. Adversarial, but she's hoping he knows something useful.

TrespassLair_255.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_255.text: A new arrival, then. You burrowed too deep, little rabbit...

TrespassLair_162.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_162.text: Put that thing down. I'm here to talk.

TrespassLair_140.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_140.text: I don't talk to prey, I -
TrespassLair_140.context:
NodeContext: Scornful, but then breaks off before finishing the line
(Full version would be 'I don't talk to prey, I skin them' if he'd finished it)

TrespassLair_127.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_127.text: ...There's something else, almost hidden by your fear-stink... cherries, musk... and sulphur.
TrespassLair_127.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sniffs the air, then face suddenly overcome by shock and anger on 'sulphur'NodeContext: Sniffing the air at the start, detecting something - then erupting with fury at the end on 'sulphur'.

TrespassLair_219.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_219.text: Raphael! I can smell him all over you. Where is he?!
TrespassLair_219.context: CinematicNodeContext: Explosive anger. Snarling, gesturing crossbow threateningly.NodeContext: Furious

TrespassLair_21.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_21.text: That perfumed trickster swindled me - trapped me.

TrespassLair_251.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_251.text: I've had dealings with that devil. Maybe we can help each other.

TrespassLair_18.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_18.text: Perhaps I can help you escape his trap.

TrespassLair_2.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_2.text: Where is he? Spit it out - Now.

TrespassLair_218.speaker: Astarion
TrespassLair_218.text: What are you doing? The devil told us to kill this thing, so let's stop chatting and kill it.

TrespassLair_28.speaker: Lae'zel
TrespassLair_28.text: Tell him, or don't - it doesn't matter, so long as you grant me the killing blow.

TrespassLair_242.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_242.text: Let's share our experiences about Raphael. Perhaps we can help each other.

TrespassLair_57.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_57.text: Raphael could be anywhere. But let me go, and I'll free you from his grasp.

TrespassLair_24.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_24.text: Bargaining, are you? A Kara-Tur warlord once tried the same - I made him watch as I ate his concubines and young, then fashioned a codpiece from his skull.
TrespassLair_24.context: NodeContext: Menacing - 'You think you can negotiate?' Pronunciation: kah-rah-TOOR

TrespassLair_226.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_226.text: Besides, I told you already - I'm bound to this place.

TrespassLair_144.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_144.text: You can't help. It's not just walls that keep me here. Not the traps, the dark or the creatures it hides. Something stronger holds me - a contract.

TrespassLair_114.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_114.text: Either I fulfil the contract, die trying... or forfeit my freedom. If I leave this place now, I'll become Raphael's slave.

TrespassLair_175.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_175.text: Show me this contract. Perhaps there's something you missed.

TrespassLair_9.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_9.text: You're hardly free as it is, trapped here. Maybe you're better off indebted to Raphael.

TrespassLair_246.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_246.text: You wouldn't say that if you truly knew his mind. Just listen to the terms he gave me.
TrespassLair_246.context: NodeContext: Terse, foreboding. 'You've no idea what you're talking about'

TrespassLair_136.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_136.text: The likes of you is frightened of a contract? I find that hard to swallow.

TrespassLair_222.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_222.text: Maybe you'll find a crossbow bolt down your throat easier to manage.
TrespassLair_222.context: NodeContext: Offended/aggressive at the player's insinuation he's unduly concerned about his contract.

TrespassLair_46.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_46.text: I happen to be an expert in such deals - and there is always a loophole.

TrespassLair_39.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_39.text: Raphael is no foolish story-devil, his mind is different. Sneaky. Listen...

TrespassLair_112.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_112.text:
Spill all the blood sworn to the night.
Silence all prayers; smother each rite.
TrespassLair_112.context: CinematicNodeContext: The orthon sings to the player.NodeContext: singing, a cappella

TrespassLair_170.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_170.text:
Wander Shar's halls; hungry to slay;
Leave no Justiciar alive to obey.
TrespassLair_170.context: CinematicNodeContext: The orthon sings to the player.NodeContext: singing, a cappella

TrespassLair_33.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_33.text:
Leave none to hear it, then be set free;
This song is your oath, swear, swear it to me.
TrespassLair_33.context: CinematicNodeContext: The orthon sings to the player.NodeContext: singing, a cappella

TrespassLair_91.speaker: Narrator
TrespassLair_91.text: *Well, that explains where all the Dark Justiciars went.*

TrespassLair_237.speaker: Narrator
TrespassLair_237.text: *A fey giggle sounds in the back of your mind - seems as though your patron enjoys a tricksy contract.*

TrespassLair_215.speaker: Narrator
TrespassLair_215.text: *Especially one with a built-in loophole. The song's last couplet is a clause that's near impossible to fulfil.*

TrespassLair_34.speaker: Narrator
TrespassLair_34.text: *The final lyrics linger in your mind. There is a trick buried within them - a clause that cannot easily be fulfilled.*
TrespassLair_34.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the player passes a passive check or if they are a bard.

TrespassLair_19.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_19.context: CinematicNodeContext: Slight smile as he considers the player, as if he's realised something.NodeContext: A little knowing (double meaning in 'that's it' - the song has ended, but he also thinks he's stumbled upon a revelation in the lyrics.)

TrespassLair_60.speaker: Astarion
TrespassLair_60.text: So he's the one who slaughtered the Justiciars - we can kill him now?

TrespassLair_105.speaker: Astarion
TrespassLair_105.text: Because if he doesn't die, then Raphael won't tell me a damn thing about my scars.

TrespassLair_231.speaker: Lae'zel
TrespassLair_231.text: He killed Shar's faithful? Then he's due our congratulations before we butcher him.

TrespassLair_217.speaker: Shadowheart
TrespassLair_217.text: So he's responsible for the carnage down here. All those Dark Justiciars... slaughtered.
TrespassLair_217.context: NodeContext: Cool anger followed by a slight note of mournfulness as she realises she's facing the creature that killed many Shar followers

TrespassLair_11.speaker: Karlach
TrespassLair_11.text: Not surprised this guy stomped all those Dark Justiciars. It's what orthons do.

TrespassLair_117.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_117.text: Parchment can burn. Oral agreements aren't worth the tongues they're waggled out upon. A song lingers.

TrespassLair_16.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_16.text: Raphael made double-sure of that: I can't forget the damned thing so long as my work's not finished.

TrespassLair_29.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_29.text: I did as instructed, but the song still rattles about in my head - the contract still stands, somehow. If I break it, I will become Raphael's slave forever.

TrespassLair_37.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_37.text: Anyway, enough prattle. The lyrics are clear - all who hear the song must die.
TrespassLair_37.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tilts his head and looks at the player, as if appraising them.NodeContext: Brutally matter-of-fact

TrespassLair_48.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Raises his crossbow and points it at the player.

TrespassLair_243.speaker: Narrator
TrespassLair_243.text: *You feel your patron's prickling flame at the back of your mind - and its diabolic words on your tongue. It wants to help.*

TrespassLair_120.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_120.text: It's Raphael you want, not me.

TrespassLair_185.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_185.text: I'll have both, if I wish.
TrespassLair_185.context: NodeContext: Growled retort. 'Don't tell me what I want'

TrespassLair_73.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_73.text: Wait - there's one last Dark Justiciar. I met him.

TrespassLair_201.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_201.text: Don't insult me - I'd know if there was a Justiciar down there.

TrespassLair_97.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_97.text: But go on - spill some blood, prove me wrong. If there truly is a Justiciar, the song will end and you will be vindicated.

TrespassLair_125.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_125.text: All right, leave it to me.

TrespassLair_100.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_100.text: I'm not your errand-runner, or your butcher.

TrespassLair_248.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_248.text: Do I look like I'm offering charity? What will you give me in return?

TrespassLair_13.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_13.text: Haggling. A grubby little trait. Fine, there's a gem I keep over by my bed. Kill the Justiciar, and it's yours.

TrespassLair_53.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_53.text: Go on then. But if you're lying - if you run - there'll be nowhere that's safe for you.

TrespassLair_244.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_244.text: I'll spare your life - that's ample reward.
TrespassLair_244.context: NodeContext: 'Be happy with your lot, or else'

TrespassLair_235.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_235.text: There's a necromancer called Balthazar elsewhere in the temple - perhaps he's the one you need to kill.

TrespassLair_206.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_206.text: I caught the scent of that bloated carcass already - he's no more alive than the Dark Justiciars down here.

TrespassLair_254.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_254.text: No. He is not the answer. He is not my prey.

TrespassLair_139.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_139.text: There must be something you missed. Let me search this place for you.

TrespassLair_164.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_164.text: I spent a century roaming these halls - I spilled every drop of Dark Justiciar blood that there was to spill. And you think you can do better?
TrespassLair_164.context: NodeContext: Menacing. Drawing out the moment.

TrespassLair_233.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_233.text: Go on then - I'll enjoy watching you fail. But try to run, and you will regret it.
TrespassLair_233.context: NodeContext: Sardonic. Doesn't favour the player's chances. Tenday = in-universe period of time.

TrespassLair_245.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_245.text: I may be trapped here, but I'm not without friends. If you break your word, they'll hunt you down and make your final moments a symphony of agony.

TrespassLair_247.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_247.text: I already have plenty of lackeys. All you have to offer me is your death.

TrespassLair_228.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_228.text: The lyrics are a trick. You've always had an audience - your followers. Get rid of them.

TrespassLair_106.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_106.text: The merregons? They barely have a thought to share among themselves... but they do have ears.

TrespassLair_135.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_135.text: Kill yourselves - back to the hells with you.
TrespassLair_135.context: NodeContext: Addressing the merregons. Matter of fact, like he's telling them they can clock off early.

TrespassLair_150.context: CinematicNodeContext: The merregons pair off, facing each other. Each one simultaneously raises their halberd against the other, then swing. Cut to the player reacting to the moment of impact, heard off-screen.

TrespassLair_45.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_45.text: I still hear it. Seems your theory is wrong.
TrespassLair_45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cocks his head slightly, as if listening to something, then glares at the player.NodeContext: Temper building. Thinks he's been dupped.

TrespassLair_65.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_65.text: Displacer hearing is notoriously sharp. You must kill her too.

TrespassLair_64.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_64.text: You're not finished yet - the displacer can hear you, can't she? Kill her.

TrespassLair_180.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_180.context: CinematicNodeContext: The orthon looks at the displacer, who gazes back at him with an adoring purr.NodeContext: Hesitant

TrespassLair_5.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Levels his crossbow at the displacerNodeContext: Solemn

TrespassLair_258.context: CinematicNodeContext: The orthon shoots the displacer with his crossbow.

TrespassLair_190.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_190.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orthon drops his crossbow and produces a sword from behind his waist.NodeContext: Seething, murderous

TrespassLair_230.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_230.text: Exactly. Kill yourself, complete the contract, and you'll be reborn in Avernus. Free.

TrespassLair_147.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_147.text: Kill yourself, coward. Then you'll return to Avernus. You'll be free.

TrespassLair_159.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_159.text: If you're wrong about this, I'll claw my way out of Avernus and eat you alive - contract be damned.

TrespassLair_84.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_84.context: CinematicNodeContext: The orthon looks upward, as if addressing Raphael up on the surface. NodeContext: Resignation/begrudging respect.

TrespassLair_214.context: CinematicNodeContext: The orthon turns the tip of his sword around to face himself, and rams it into his own torso. He falls dead.

TrespassLair_94.speaker: Lae'zel
TrespassLair_94.text: An acceptable conclusion. But it is a shame I won't know the pleasure of executing a wardevil.

TrespassLair_122.speaker: Lae'zel
TrespassLair_122.text: Well. There is always next time.

TrespassLair_85.speaker: Karlach
TrespassLair_85.text: Damn. Now there's something I never thought I'd see. Brutal.
TrespassLair_85.context: NodeContext: Not too heartbroken, kind of bemused

TrespassLair_239.speaker: Astarion
TrespassLair_239.text: That was incredible - I'm actually impressed! You have a wicked little mind.
TrespassLair_239.context: NodeContext: Emphasise each of the first three words. "That. Was. Incredible."

TrespassLair_208.speaker: Gale
TrespassLair_208.text: I see the art of eloquence is alive and well. I'm awed, impressed, and a little bit scared of you right now.

TrespassLair_137.speaker: Wyll
TrespassLair_137.text: Balduran's bones, what a performance - you'd put the Five Flagons to shame!

TrespassLair_196.speaker: Shadowheart
TrespassLair_196.text: That silver tongue of yours is dangerous - bravo. I can't believe you actually pulled that off...
TrespassLair_196.context: NodeContext: Impressed. The player pulled off a very unlikely series of persuasion moments against a potential foe.

TrespassLair_27.speaker: Astarion
TrespassLair_27.text: Does... does that count as us killing him? That had better count.

TrespassLair_76.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_76.text: Maybe that's true, maybe not - but I don't have to let you live in order to find out.

TrespassLair_209.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_209.text: My dear hunter, isn't it obvious? You must kill yourself - then you'll be free.

TrespassLair_213.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_213.text: Exactly. Kill yourself, complete the contract, and you'll be reborn in Avernus. Free.

TrespassLair_224.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_224.text: Kill yourself, coward. Then you'll return to Avernus. You'll be free.

TrespassLair_4.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_4.text: My dear hunter, isn't it obvious? You must kill yourself - then you'll be free.

TrespassLair_227.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_227.text: Pathetic. A dusk hag once claimed she dreamt of a future where I spared her, but even her weaselling is no match for yours. This ends now.

TrespassLair_256.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_256.text: Raphael's a sly lyricist - he tricked you. Your followers heard your song and still live.

TrespassLair_182.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_182.text: You always hear the song, orthon. Kill yourself, be reborn in the Hells, break the contract.

TrespassLair_198.speaker: Narrator
TrespassLair_198.text: *Both far away and all too close, you feel your patron's grin. A job well done.*

TrespassLair_221.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_221.text: Wait! You might have missed something, and I'm uniquely good at tracking things down.

TrespassLair_181.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_181.text: Raphael wanted you to kill Dark Justiciars? Why?

TrespassLair_123.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_123.text: Asking why doesn't get me paid - hunting and killing does. Raphael mentioned something about an aasimar. Meant nothing to me.
TrespassLair_123.context: InternalNodeContext: Aasimar reference being a hint towards Nightsong.NodeContext: Pronounced AH-sim-ar.

TrespassLair_152.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_152.text: I did my part - I filled these halls with ghosts. But Raphael's playing some other game - one that involves stiffing me.

TrespassLair_234.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_234.text: It's been some time since I had an audience. Any who hear it tend to die.

TrespassLair_77.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_77.text: That was awful - perhaps you should stick to killing.

TrespassLair_193.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_193.text: Oh, I intend to. The lyrics are clear - all who hear the song must die.

TrespassLair_69.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_69.text: Quite bloodthirsty, as lyrics go. Have you considered some instrumental accompaniment?

TrespassLair_174.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_174.text: I don't want to make it pretty - I want to silence it.

TrespassLair_56.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_56.text: Shar is not my goddess, but I can respect her. I ought to kill you for what you have done to her temple.

TrespassLair_191.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_191.text: Ought you? The Dark Justiciars all failed - and made the most interesting noises as they died. Some even called out to other gods for help...

TrespassLair_38.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_38.text: Then they failed her, and you never met a true servant of Shar.

TrespassLair_63.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_63.text: What, they're no longer worth avenging? You're a fickle creature, little Sharran.

TrespassLair_260.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_260.text: A deception. The Dark Lady would approve of them trying to sway you.

TrespassLair_104.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_104.text: You give them too much credit. And show more spine than they did - at least until I flayed them.

TrespassLair_59.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_59.text: You blaspheme this holy place. I must strike you down.

TrespassLair_6.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_6.text: Bold of you. Stupid, but bold.
TrespassLair_6.context: NodeContext: Dry. Not overly concerned that the player's about to attack (combat ensues after this line)

TrespassLair_116.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_116.text: Shar is not my goddess, but I can respect her. I ought to kill you for what you have done to her temple.

TrespassLair_149.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_149.text: You desecrated Shar's temple? You slew her children? I ought to kill you.

TrespassLair_145.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_145.text: A pact made from song? Quite quaint for a devil, I must say.

TrespassLair_207.speaker: Astarion
TrespassLair_207.text: Pretty tune for a contract that says 'kill all Justiciars'.

TrespassLair_241.speaker: Wyll
TrespassLair_241.text: So this was the wardevil who slaughtered Shar's faithful. At Raphael's urging, no less.

TrespassLair_92.speaker: Gale
TrespassLair_92.text: So he's the one who killed all the Dark Justiciars. Alone. Might not want to get on his bad side.

TrespassLair_20.speaker: Karlach
TrespassLair_20.text: Not surprised this guy single-handedly wiped out the Dark Justiciars here. Fucker is stacked.

TrespassLair_210.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_210.text: Diabolic deals in legend always have loopholes - we just need to find it.

TrespassLair_225.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_225.text: Raphael is a devil like all your kind - he deals in tricks. You probably missed a loophole in your contract.

TrespassLair_177.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_177.text: If you won't speak, then you don't need to draw breath. Tell me what I want, or I'll feed you to my pet over a tenday, and keep you alive to watch.

TrespassLair_232.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_232.text: I've got nothing to spit out - not for you, anyway.

TrespassLair_151.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_151.text: Help me with my infernal engine, and I'll tell you.

TrespassLair_47.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_47.text: I deal in blood and bones - not cogs and wrenches. Tell me what I wish to know, or you'll find that out first hand.

TrespassLair_236.speaker: Shadowheart
TrespassLair_236.text: Careful -  I'm not sure we want Raphael as an enemy.

TrespassLair_153.speaker: Karlach
TrespassLair_153.text: We piss off a devil no matter what we do. Pick your poison - we'll handle the fallout like we always do.

TrespassLair_74.speaker: Astarion
TrespassLair_74.text: Well? Tell him. We owe the devil nothing.

TrespassLair_163.speaker: Wyll
TrespassLair_163.text: Go on, tell the bastard. All the better for us if he keeps Raphael - busy.

TrespassLair_61.speaker: Gale
TrespassLair_61.text: While two devils fight over a bone - well, we should just run away and let them sort it among themselves.

TrespassLair_204.speaker: Karlach
TrespassLair_204.text: I'm not one to placate a devil, but the last thing we need is an orthon for an enemy. Fought one once, and my back has never been the same.

TrespassLair_54.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_54.text: There's nothing stopping you from leaving. I know a way out.

TrespassLair_167.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_167.text: Hah! There's my word. I agreed to a contract - one that hasn't yet been fulfilled.
TrespassLair_167.context: NodeContext: Sardonic. Short, bitter bark of a laugh at the start.

TrespassLair_189.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_189.text: No trap is inescapable, trust me.

TrespassLair_22.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_22.text: Hah! Perhaps this is true of the mundane traps you know. But I am held here by something stronger.

TrespassLair_12.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_12.text: Words. A contract penned by that deceitful slug Raphael.

TrespassLair_49.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_49.text: I don't know what you mean.

TrespassLair_253.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_253.text: Lies! My nose would recognise him anywhere.

TrespassLair_172.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_172.text: I'd never ally myself with such a fiend.

TrespassLair_107.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_107.text: I don't keep company with devils.

TrespassLair_78.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_78.text: The devil has been stalking my companions - what dealings do you have with him?

TrespassLair_132.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_132.text: Stupid rabbit. Running can't save you.

TrespassLair_108.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_108.text: Well, allow me to hop to it - I want to talk.

TrespassLair_240.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_240.text: If I was burrowing, you'd never find me.

TrespassLair_176.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_176.text: I would sniff you out in an instant. Prey like you always has a most distinctive scent, it's like...

TrespassLair_109.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_109.text: This 'rabbit' has hunted prey larger than you. I suggest you choose your next words wisely.

TrespassLair_86.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_86.text: I'll burrow my fist into your chest if you don't stop mouthing off.

TrespassLair_42.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_42.text: You are mouthy, little rabbit. This will be -
TrespassLair_42.context:
NodeContext: Scornful, but then breaks off before finishing the line
(Full version would be 'This will be over quickly'' if he'd finished it)

TrespassLair_62.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_62.text: Your words thrum with violence. Peace - let us speak.

TrespassLair_156.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_156.text: My apologies. Try as I might, the surface-stink just won't wash off.

TrespassLair_261.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_261.text: I smell the depths below that is true, but...

TrespassLair_88.speaker: Player
TrespassLair_88.text: I may stink of the surface, but it's not where I hail from.

TrespassLair_220.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_220.text: You are star-touched that is true, but...

TrespassLair_35.speaker: Yurgir
TrespassLair_35.text: Oh no, little rabbit. You don't get to just hop away.

AD_MineClusterAbility_0.speaker: Yurgir
AD_MineClusterAbility_0.text: Let's see how many pieces can be blasted off you before you die.

PAD_VictimsDisplay_0.speaker: Player
PAD_VictimsDisplay_0.text: A very gory idea of art.

PAD_VictimsDisplay_1.speaker: Player
PAD_VictimsDisplay_1.text: This orthon isn't just a killer. He's an artist, too.
PAD_VictimsDisplay_1.context: NodeContext: A bit of sarcasm. It may be 'art' but not to the player (except Astarion probably)

AD_VictimStand_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_VictimStand_0.text: *A foul totem of agony, mounted with sadistic relish.*

AD_BetrayedByDisplacer_0.speaker: Yurgir
AD_BetrayedByDisplacer_0.context: NodeContext: Surprised/somewhat distraught as his displacer beast companion turns on him mid-combat

AD_MonitorLeaves_0.speaker: Raphael
AD_MonitorLeaves_0.context: NodeContext: annoyed, players just attacked him. He's unharmed, but teleports away, abandoning them
